title: Solved: Netflix Error F7121-1331
content:
After having the error F7121-1331 when trying to watch a Netflix video, I found that the privacy.resistFingerprinting was the source of the problem.

You can keep this option and change the parameters in about:config

  • privacy.resistFingerprinting.testGranularityMask : 4
  • privacy.resistFingerprinting.exemptedDomains : *.netflix.com, *.nflxext.com

title: How to open files from other user's home?
content:
I'm in Ubuntu 22.04, logged in as user-me. I would like to open /home/user-other/path/to/index.html with firefox.

user-me is in the group user-other, and everything under /home/user-other has permission 755. I can open /home/user-other/path/to/index.html in the terminal without problem.

If I simply type /home/user-other/path/to/index.html in the address bar of firefox, it gives "Access to the file was denied". If I open the file with the file picker, the page is loaded, but as "file:///run/user/1000/doc/some-hax-number/index.html", and the resources in the page are not properly loaded.

How can I properly open /home/user-other/path/to/index.html?
creator: champignoom

title: ManagedBookmarks [JSON]
content:
Hello,

Firefox 102.6.0esr (x64) Firefox 108.2.0 (x64)

after implementing the bookmarks (JSON) setting by GPO policy, it turns out that an entry for Bookmarks is created in the registry and not ManagedBookmarks, which causes bookmarks not to appear in the bookmarks bar. When I manually rename a registry entry from Bookmarks to ManagedBookmarks, the bookmarks appear properly. Please let me know if I'm doing something wrong or if there really is a problem reported by me.

Yours sincerely Bart
creator: bartekbrzozka

title: Firefox freezes up once a day within 30 minutes of being started
content:
Every morning I start up Firefox and within 30 minutes of it starting it seems to at some point start to stop working. I can open new tabs, but URLs will not load. Tabs that already have pages loaded won't load new pages. Basically, the UI works but the browser can't load anything.

I have to close Firefox, and then when I start it up again. I have to kill the last process that didn't close cleanly.

After this, Firefox will work for the rest of the day without issue. The next day the same thing happens.

I tried reinstalling Firefox, and I know it is updated to the latest version. I haven't found any issues described like this while looking for help on this, so wondering what to do about this, short of moving to Chrome on this computer.

title: page reload is six times (5.73x) slower than chrome
content:
_05: chrome browser network panel after refreshing 5 times domContentLoaded: 328ms

_06: firefox browser network panel after refreshing 5 times domContentLoaded: 1880ms (5.73x slower)

the problem seems from that the request from firefox gets 200 wheras chrome gets 304 unmodified, which explains the huge speed difference in reloading.
